parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To roll, roll up, fold up. A form of heilisso; to coil or wrap.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of periballo; something thrown around one, i.e. A mantle, veil.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To change, alter, exchange, transform. From allos; to make different.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To fail, die out, come to an end, be defunct. From ek and leipo; to omit, i.e. cease.
